title: Cognitive Electrophysiology UK: Getting the Most from Studies of Memory, Language and Attention.
abstractText:
This seminar series is designed to provide a forum for the UK’s cognitive electrophysiology researchers. Since the introduction of neuroimaging methods such as fMRI (functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging) the related technique of Event Related Potentials (ERPs, a measure of brain activity derived from EEG - the electroencapholgram) has become a mainstay of the human cognitive neuroimaging field. This method allows investigation of the functional and neural basis of abilities such as memory, attention and language, and provides fine-grained information about the time course of cognitive processing.

The aim of the current proposal is to bring together the strong but widely distributed expertise that exists across the UK. At present there are a large number of researchers using similar ERP research methods to investigate similar questions about cognition, but who have very little direct interaction. The seminar series will bring together researchers, producing a web-based directory of ERP researchers in the UK, providing a forum for discussion on-line, and hopefully encouraging continued interaction and collaboration long after the series has finished. The series will also involve a series of meetings and training events, highlighting important methodological advances, and allowing the development of ‘best practice’ across researcher laboratories.
